definition: to spring up everywhere/from all around
four/4

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
pinyin: feng1 yan1 si4 qi3 , zhan4 huo3 fen1 fei1

sentences.english: He was charged with four robberies.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控犯有四起抢劫罪。

sentences.english: The minister's speech was greeted with jeers and catcalls.
sentences.chinese: 这位大臣的讲话遭到嘲笑，嘘声四起。

sentences.english: When such complaints arise in France's most sensitive industry -- nuclear power -- alarm bells start ringing.
sentences.chinese: 当法国最敏感的核能产业怨声四起时，警钟已经敲响。

sentences.english: Last week was a week of serious financial turbulance in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 上周在欧洲是严重金融风波四起的一周。

sentences.english: Rumours have circulated that Obama was not born in America and that he plans to ban firearms.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马并非出生在美国以及他准备禁枪的谣言四起。

sentences.english: A Chinese art report shows the world of hero everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 一份中国美术报便可见天下英雄四起。

sentences.english: It has brought organized crime to towns and cities across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 干预还使得有组织犯罪在欧洲的小镇和城市中四起。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, a fire broke out on each of the city's towers. There was chaos inside the city.
sentences.chinese: 此时各城楼突然大火四起，城中顿时大乱。

sentences.english: Falling, the star, flaming, the fire.
On the boundless wasteland, thousands of horses are galloping ahead in the dust rising from all directions.
sentences.chinese: 在一望无际的荒原上，万马奔腾，尘烟四起。

sentences.english: Gunfire crackles. Voices rise in crescendo, chanting for the regime to fall.
sentences.chinese: 枪声四起，打到阿萨德政权的呼声一浪高过一浪。

sentences.english: There was fire everywhere and silence and bodies were burning.
sentences.chinese: 火焰四起，一片静寂，很多人被烧了。

definition: (of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on

up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
continuously arising/to arise repeatedly
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
see 此起彼伏[ci3 qi3 bi3 fu2]
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
unending/uninterrupted
a confused noise/a racket
to wail like ghosts and howl like wolves (idiom)
lit. people shouting and horses neighing (idiom)/fig. tumultuous/hubbub
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
to shake heaven and earth (idiom)
to soar/to rocket
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
